ygData.msgSnippet: Somewhat off-topic for research, but on-topic for languages.  Be warned. ... I thought the pieces of bamboo were there for Gnomes to tinker into fishing poles?
ygData.messageBody:
Somewhat off-topic for research, but on-topic for languages. Be warned.


>Kinda like the leftover Bardic instrument-making materials you see all over
>(pieces of bamboo, unfinished brass trumpets, etc.) it's a leftover from a
>bygone era.


I thought the pieces of bamboo were there for Gnomes to tinker into fishing
poles?

I have a Bard who set out to learn every language in the game since day
one. Now that I know he'll never be able to put them to any practical
use, I'm probably still going with it as a role-playing thing. If you
ever bump into Satyric on Bristlebane, feel free to teach him a language.
Maybe I'll be able to use it in a quest or something someday.

Another nifty possible use for languages: improving your faction with
someone. Going up to a merchant of another race and addressing them
fluently in their own tongue should be worth something, shouldn't it? Not
that it is yet, but it'd be a fun suggestion for the non-magic races to get
some small use out of languages.

Last thought: I wonder if it's possible to teach languages over a Guild
channel?

Satyric
